alert.note: Alert for Orange; Riverside; San Bernardino; San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 08 at 1:55PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 621 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Orange, Riverside, San Bernardino and far northern San Diego. * WHEN...Until 621 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas will redevelop. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 155 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain showers increasing across Orange County and Inland Empire moving into San Bernardino mountains. This will cause addition urban and small stream flooding during the commute 3 to 6 pm. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen so grounds are wet and water is flowing. - San Bernardino mountains is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes Bond, El Dorado and Apple scars. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.25 inches are expected over the area. Locally up to additional 2 to 3 inches in foothills. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anaheim, Santa Ana, Riverside, Irvine, San Bernardino, Fontana, Moreno Valley, Huntington Beach, Garden Grove and Ontario. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Orange; Riverside; San Bernardino; San Diego
